p: We do this to simulate multiple seasons that spread spatially like the 2014-15 season, but vary in their severity (captured by the national attack size E) and the efficacy of seasonal vaccine (captured by v). In our study setting, we construct 12 scenarios, where v takes values in {0.2, 0.35, 0.5} and E takes values in {40, 61, 73, 86} where the values are in millions of cases, corresponding to different severity levels based on past seasons of seasonal influenza. Thus for each target attack size E, we have three scenarios, in which E is achieved by assigning vaccines at v efficacy.
